text.text:
The hotel is conveniently located at Lucknow Airport's T3 terminal, with the metro station just a short walk away—perfect for transit travelers. The room is clean, spacious, and well-maintained, as you'd expect from a quality hotel. However, a minor downside is that the hotel is located underground, so there’s no natural sunlight, making it hard to tell if it’s day or night. This might actually be a plus for those traveling across time zones, though!
The restaurant wasn’t in full swing during my stay, likely because the hotel is still new and just starting to get everything up and running. Hopefully, it’ll be fully functional soon!

editorialSummary.text: Informal airport hotel offering a buffet restaurant & a rooftop grill, plus an outdoor pool.

text.text:
Dear Hotel Holiday Inn Team,

I am writing to share my recent experiences at your hotel, which have raised concerns about the food safety and hygiene standards. On August 12th, around 22:35, I dined at your evening buffet and was served Chicken Malai. Unfortunately, upon inspecting the dish, I found a hair in it. I immediately brought this to the attention of the Floor Chef and Duty Manager, who took the issue seriously and apologized for the inconvenience.

The Chef and Duty Manager offered to replace the dish, but given the nature of the issue, I decided not to continue with my meal. As a guest, it's unsettling to encounter such an incident, and it raises questions about the quality control measures in place.

Furthermore, I had a similar experience the previous day when I requested your floor team to send some fresh dishes from the buffet to my room as I returned late from a site visit. To my surprise, I received leftover food from the buffet, which was not what I had requested. This incident not only raised concerns about food handling but also made me question whether the hotel was prioritizing cost savings over serving fresh food to guests.

While I appreciate the prompt response from the Chef and Duty Manager regarding the hair incident, these experiences collectively raise concerns about the overall food safety and hygiene standards at your hotel. I understand that mistakes can happen, but I hope you'll take this feedback constructively and review your quality control processes to ensure the highest standards of food safety and hygiene.

I hope that you will take my feedback seriously and take necessary actions to address these concerns. I look forward to hearing from you and seeing improvements in your Service.

A Perfect Stay Near Lucknow Airport!

I had an absolutely wonderful experience at Hotel Bluark! From the moment I arrived, the staff made me feel welcome with their polite and professional behavior. The check-in process was smooth, and the room was clean, spacious, and equipped with everything I needed – a comfortable bed, clean bathroom, air conditioning, free Wi-Fi, meal options, quiet place with great view.

The hotel is ideally located just a few minutes from the airport, making it a great option for travelers. I also loved that they allowed food deliveries from Zomato and Swiggy – very convenient!

text.text:
Very very Bad. Stay on streets but don't use this hotel.
My experience at this hotel was an absolute nightmare—by far the worst stay I've ever had. The room was filthy, the bathroom was in bad never cleaned condition, completely unclean, and the room had so much of cigarette smoke. To make matters worse, the place was full of mosquitoes, making sleep impossible.

I had only booked the room for six hours to rest before my flight, but it turned out to be a huge mistake. Trusting the reviews and paying for this disaster was the worst decision. The hotel didn't even have a proper goodnight mat, and after multiple trips to the reception, the staff reluctantly handed me one after half an hour. Their service was beyond terrible—completely indifferent to guest comfort.

Despite my exhaustion, I couldn't sleep a minute in this miserable place. The level of negligence, lack of cleanliness, and overall condition of the hotel make it unfit for anyone. If you value your sanity, avoid this place at all costs. Sleeping on the streets would be a far better option. I’d rate it negative infinity for cleanliness and service—this place shouldn’t even be in business.

text.text:
Extremely poor experience. The bathroom facilities are pathetic - unclean, badly maintained, and worst of all, they don't even allow proper usage. I came all the way from another city for an important interview, trusting the hotel to at least provide basic support. But what I got was zero hygiene, zero empathy, and a completely careless attitude.

How can a hotel deny someone proper access to a washroom, especially when they've travelled from far and need to freshen up before a big interview? It’s inhuman and totally unprofessional.

If you're coming from outside and depending on this hotel for basic comfort—think twice. This place seriously needs to upgrade both its facilities and attitude. Worst hospitality I’ve ever experienced.

text.text:
Worst Experience Ever – Do Not Book!

This place is a total scam – overpriced, untrustworthy, and unsafe. Do NOT book here if you value your money or your safety.

I had the worst experience with OYO and the property I booked! I was supposed to stay for 2 days but checked out after just 3.5 hours. The property was in terrible condition:

Broken doors – Couldn’t even secure them properly.
Broken lock on the main door – Totally unsafe!
No water in the bathroom – Completely useless.
Unsafe environment – This place is not suitable for families or women.
To top it off, the owner is lying, saying I checked out after 1 PM when I left at 9:30 AM. OYO isn’t even taking my proof seriously! I’ve provided evidence, but it feels like they don’t care. It’s like they trust the lying property owner more than their own customers.

I paid for a service I didn’t get and felt unsafe the entire time. OYO, fix this and give me my refund. You can’t just let this kind of thing slide. Never booking with OYO again!

text.text:
I recently hosted a retirement party for my mother on 15th April at Hotel Olive Crown, and I would like to express my heartfelt appreciation for the outstanding service we received. The staff demonstrated a high level of professionalism and hospitality, ensuring that all our guests felt welcome and comfortable.

A special thanks goes to Mr. Mohit, the manager, who truly delivered on his promise of making the event memorable. His attention to detail, efficient coordination, and courteous demeanor played a major role in the success of the celebration. The food, ambiance, and overall arrangements were highly appreciated by all attendees.

Thank you once again to Mr. Mohit and the entire team at Hotel Olive Crown for making this occasion so special. I look forward to hosting more events with you in the future

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Green Home Stay in Lucknow with my family, and I can confidently say it was an amazing experience. From the moment we arrived, the host couple Seema Ma'am and Neeraj Sir made us feel incredibly welcome and like part of their family. Their warmth and hospitality were truly exceptional, always ensuring we had everything we needed.

The property itself is beautifully maintained, with a cozy and homely atmosphere that instantly made us feel comfortable. One of the highlights was the lovely terrace garden—such a peaceful spot to relax and unwind after a day of exploring the city. The greenery and calm surroundings provided a refreshing escape.

Overall, our stay at The Green Home Stay was a memorable one, and I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Lucknow. It’s the perfect blend of great hospitality, comfort, and tranquility. We’ll definitely be back!

text.text:
Lemon Tree has outdone itself yet another time for my wife and I. Over the years we have developed a fondness for this chain of hotels. Their hospitality, cleanliness, service, and comfort is unmatched. I unfortunately do not remember all of the pleasant staff names. Some of them that made our stay memorable were Neeraj from house-keeping, Amit & Saurav from F&B. It is because of the exceptional service delivered by the staff, it is a given that our first preference for a hotel is always going to be Lemon Tree.

Yet, I've given it 4 stars and not 5. We did not get a good variety of Lucknow / Awadhi cuisine at the Citrus cafe in the hotel. Also, there was always some noise disturbance from outside the room during the day.

text.text:
Green Homestay was the perfect start to our Lucknow trip. Located in a quiet neighborhood near the airport, it’s well-connected by road and metro, making it a convenient choice.

The room was cozy and immaculate, with a comfortable bed, a clean bathroom, and plenty of natural light. The property’s highlight was its beautiful terrace garden, brimming with greenery and vibrant flowers. We enjoyed relaxing in the air-conditioned glass-walled gazebo on the terrace, ideal for reading or watching matches on the projector.

Our hosts, Neeraj and Seema, were exceptional. Seema provided fantastic shopping tips, while Neeraj, an architect, shared engaging stories about Lucknow’s history and modern transformation. His eatery recommendations were spot on!

The home-cooked breakfast was outstanding, with Seema’s poha being a special highlight. Our stay was memorable, and we’re already looking forward to returning.

text.text:
I recently stayed at Green homestay in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, and I must say it was an absolutely delightful experience! From the moment I arrived until the day of my departure, everything about this homestay exceeded my expectations.

First and foremost, the hosts were incredibly warm and welcoming. They made me feel like a part of their family right from the start. Their genuine hospitality and attention to detail were remarkable. They were always available to assist me with anything I needed and were more than happy to provide local tips and recommendations for exploring Lucknow.

The homestay itself was beautifully decorated and immaculately maintained. The rooms were spacious, clean, and comfortable, offering a peaceful retreat after a day of sightseeing. I particularly loved the traditional touch in the interior design, which added to the overall charm of the place.

The location of the homestay was also a huge plus. It was conveniently situated in a quiet neighborhood, away from the hustle and bustle of the city center, yet still within easy reach of major attractions. This allowed me to experience the tranquility of Lucknow while having convenient access to explore its vibrant culture and heritage sites.

Another highlight of my stay was the delectable home-cooked meals. The hosts prepared authentic Lucknowi dishes that were bursting with flavors. Each meal was a culinary delight, and it truly felt like a gastronomic journey through the rich Awadhi cuisine. The personalized touch and the use of fresh, locally sourced ingredients made the dining experience exceptional.

Furthermore, the homestay offered a range of amenities that ensured my stay was comfortable and convenient.
